head.supplied: Cambewarra ¶ 29/6/88 ¶ ¶ […] About Log Nro. 60, of which I also sent Kino, I had word from Baron von Muller since; the species seems not to be known to him, and he seems to be inclined to consider it...

div.p: MRS 203, Inwards correspondence — special bundles, 1886-1921 Item 1, Registered in-letter 88/202, Archives of the Powerhouse Museum, Sydney.

[…] About Log Nro. 60, of which I also sent Kino, I had word from Baron von Muller since; the species seems not to be known to him, and he seems to be inclined to consider it as a Hybrid, but at present, owing to pressure of work in connection with forthcoming exhibition, he has no time for critical investigation. In view that it may be a Hybrid, I have enclosed a piece of timber of it in the case, which will season sooner than the logs. The tradesman, who does up my small cabinet specimens speaks of it as excellent timber and different from any other Eucalyptus he has worked. […]
Not relevant.
